intro: Schkuhria abrotanoides var. pomasquiensis, commonly known as the Pomasquiensis false holly, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is adapted to withstand drought conditions. This variant is distinguished by its unique floral structure and geographic distribution.
